page.title: 06MINING FOR CLAY ON ARNE
page.content: In September 1974 the issue of Ball Clay mining on the beautiful Arne Peninsula came to a head. 200 objection letters were received by the County Planners and a Wareham-Arne Action Group was set up with the support of many conservationists,and on September 25 1974 an 800 signature petition was presented to the Planning Committee. The Planning Committee was recommended to pay compensation to the English China Clay Company who had already been granted permission to mine for the Ball Clay.This proved unpopular with many people as the ratepayers would in effect be stopping the "Rape of Arne".The outcome was for the mining to commence,but 10 years later,the mining has had little influence on the landscape.
